result.title: The 1st Smart Short Film Festival
result.summary: The purpose of the proposal is to hold a Brazilian short film festival. Initially, there will be an analysis of the material sent to the organizing committee which will consist of the selection of approximately 50 short films to be screened on festival days. At the end of the week of exhibition, the best short film will be awarded, according to the classified category, and the payment of prizes will be made in Smartcash. Besides the proposal and other forms of disclosure that will promote the advertising of Smartcash and consequently the expansion of the cryptocurrency.
result.description:
DETAILED PROPOSAL             

 

The 1st Smart Short Film Festival aims to achieve 2 goals, as detailed below:               

• Disclose SmartCash in the cultural sphere, specifically, in independent cinema.     

           For the first edition of the Smart Short Film Festival, it will be possible to register short films that were made from 01/2017, in order to reach the largest possible number of subscribers. In order to attend the event, the applicant must complete an application form, which will provide details about the film, e-mail registered with Smartcash and its public key to receive the prize offered.

            Thus, the 1st Smart Short Film Festival will be a differential for Smartcash, arousing interest in the community, highlighting it in research and encouraging its use. The ideas of the Smartcash community will be shared and disseminated in the Brazilian cinema scene and the expectation is that they reach between 800 and 1,000 inscriptions.              

            It will be organized in various media outlets specializing in promoting film festivals such as Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp groups and Telegram. For an approximate period of 2 months giving such time for conducting research by people outside the world of cryptocurrency.

 

 • Make Smartcash the currency of the national cinema.   

            The 1st Smart Short Film Festival intends to expand the use of Smartcash, for this will be made announcements in the intervals of the short film sessions, with Youtube videos of the official Smartcash channel. There will also be an allocation of a stand by Smartcash during the week of the festival for the promotion of Smart, thus seeking to highlight one of its main characteristics, usability! That within Brazil has been evolving greatly thanks to the commitment of the community and its efforts. For that, a negotiation is in talks with a partner company called Elitecam, which intends to accept Smartcash as payment for the leasing of its equipment   

 

AWARDS             

            The 1st Smart Short Film Festival is expected to select 10 short films to compete for the category of "Best Short Film", 10 short films for the category "Best Documentary Short Film" and 10 short films for "Best Short University Film”. For the remaining 6 categories, 5 short films will be selected. The composition of the 1st Smart Short Film Festival will be approximately 50 short films.            

             In order to have an approximate idea of ??the scope of the proposal, it is estimated that for the realization of a short film there will be the involvement of at least 10 people, between team and cast. Thus, if the Festival obtains the registration of 800 short films, there will be about 8,000 people involved, and approximately 500 of them would be directly involved. In other words, there would be 500 people accompanying and promoting the 1st Smart Short Film Festival, which could achieve an even greater impact than expected with the dissemination of prizes by the winners in their social networks and among friends.  

 

DETAILED BUDGET 

Awards

 Best Picture - $ 500.00

Best Documentary - $ 500.00

Best Short University Film - $ 250.00

Best Producer - $ 250.00

Best Photography Direction - $ 250.00

Best Art Direction - $ 250.00

Best Direct Sound - $ 250.00

Best Actress - $ 250.00

Best Actor - $ 250.00  

 

9 Smart Trophy For Winners - $ 300.00 

           Budget made by the site - https://toptrofeus.com.br/plateas-medalhas-e-trofeus-personalizados/              

           For the awards, a personalized trophy will be developed with name and the symbol of Smartcash, the bee. The trophies of a film festival are extremely symbolic and often occupy the prominent places of the people who receive them. 

 

 Social Media throughout the Festival period - $ 300.00            

 

           To save money, at this moment there won´t be a specific site for the Festival, the disclosure will be made at the moment of the call registration, disclosure of selected and subsequent dissemination of the winners through Facebook of Butikin Movies Producer or any social network Smartcash Brazil, if it is possible. 

            The Butikin Films is an independent production company that seeks to accomplish without government support film culture in Brazil and beyond the creation of this proposal will have an important role in the promotion and dissemination of the 1st Smart Short Film Festival, the work already done by Butikin Movies can be checked on the site www.butikinfilmes.com.br and any social network, searching for "Butikin Filmes".        

             The Butikin Films is waiting for a lot of doubt messages about the procedures required to start the Smartcash as well as important information on password, private key, public key, among others. Being the support in social networks, as well as Telegram support in the Brazilian group of great importance. 

 

 Curators for choosing movies - $ 1,500           

             Three people to watch and review all the films entered, (expectation of 800 films) and select those who will compete for each category.

 

 Poster and art for promotion - $ 150.00   

             Realization of a custom art for the Festival with references to Smartcash and printing of some posters. 

 

 Rental and production for the week in which the films will bescreened with awards ceremony at the end including expenses withsupporters- $ 1,000   

             The location where will be realized the exhibition of the films and the delivery of the prizes for the winners. The event will be in São Paulo / SP - Brazil, every night, starting on Monday and ending on Saturday with the announcement of the winners. There is the possibility in study of the realization of a live broadcast by Facebook.

               Inside the event and every day of the Festival, there will be a promotional stand of Smartcash to clarify doubts about the currency and its use.

               The budget for the 1st Smart Short Film Festival is divided into U $ 2,750.00 in prizes and U $ 3,250.00 in organization. A total of $ 6,000.00, plus the sweat of those involved for the achievement! 

 Schedule of achievement 

09/2018 - Festival announcement

                  Promotion of Smartcash 

                  Clarifications of doubts 

 

10/2018 - Festival announcement 

                  Promotion of Smartcash 

                  Clarification of doubts 

                  Selection of films 

 

11/2018 - Promotion of Smartcash 

                  Clarification of doubts 

                  Selection of films 

 

12/2018 - Promotion of Smartcash 

                  Festival performance   

 

With proposal of release as follows:

 •        08/2018

Social Media throughout the Festival period - $ 300.00

Poster and art for promotion - $ 150.00

Total - $ 450.00 

 

 •        09/2018

9 Smart Trophy For Winners - $ 300.00

Curators for choosing movies - $ 1,500

Rental and production for the week in which the films will bescreened with awards ceremony at the end including expenses withsupporters- $ 1,000

Total - $ 2,800.00 

 

 ·         11/2018

Awards - U $ - 2,750.00 

Total - $ 2,750.00

 

 I hope the community believes in this project! 

               We have proposals to continue the project with an edition for Latin American films. In addition to the next editions of the festival we would like to add the option of audience votes to choose the best short film. It all depends on the performance of the proposal if approved and the interest of the community!

Events


15º Congresso Latino-americano de Software Livre e Tecnologias Abertas – Latinoware https://latinoware.org) – october 16th to 19th at Itaipu Binacional, in Foz do Iguaçu/Paraná/Brazil. (TALK SUBMITTED FOR EVALUATION)

result.title: Proposal #1: SmartCash Powered Patreon, Subscriptions, Paywalls, And More!
result.summary: Cryptocurrencies are disrupting nearly every industry but there are huge barriers of entry preventing average users from using crypto in their daily lives. I would like to develop open sourced SmartCash services to ease the sending, receiving, depositing, and withdrawal of SmartCash for any users with an internet connection.
result.description:
Description

SmartCash already provides the backend infrustructure required to compete with paypal, stripe, and many other payment processors. I would like to develop and open source SmartCash powered services to compete with paypal, stripe, patreon, and plenty of other services listed in the PDF.

 

PDF

Over the past week I have been refining my proposal to include my resume, links, research, examples, mockups, and proper formatting. The proposal editor removes a lot of these details making the proposal harder to follow. I am hosting the PDF through Google Docs to provide full access to all of the information I have included. 

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nPnNpvPOSORU4uDo6WR73zkqveFPuVX7/view?usp=sharing

 

Milestones

The dates provided for each milestone are estimates, and each feature listed within the PDF has been split into a design/frontend development sprint then backend sprint.

During development I will be requesting feedback from the SmartCash community through the forum and Discord. I will also provide a "progress report" page listing the features I am working on at that time, as well as the time remaining to complete said features.

A week into the proposal if it is trending toward being successful I plan to complete the development of the first milestone before the voting deadline, this is why it is listed shortly after the voting deadline.

 

Disclaimer

If you disagree with a milestone, or the proposal as a whole please voice your concerns within the proposal comments before voting against or abstaining. I am developing these services to address the problems I see within the ecosystem and I am open to suggestions if you have a better idea to solve xyz milestone/problem.

result.title: Swift Library for SMARTCASH

iOS Mobile Developer turning into Blockchain Engineer

Timeframe & Budget:

I hope you support this project as we try grow our community! Thanks

result.title: Integrating Native Developers Into The SmartCash Ecosystem in Africa through Hackathon
result.summary:
The adoption of Africa seem different from other parts of the world and other continent. The kind of software and marketing ideas that work well in Other parts of the world may seem not to function well down here. This project seeks to promote SmartCash ecosystem and technology and also to bring new computer engineers, software developers, programmers and other stakeholders to build new software to help move the massive adoption in Africa at a faster pace.This project also seek to  bring developers together to compete for a price in SmartCash. 
For those of as who are not familiar with hackathon, is an event where a group of individuals gather for 24-48 hours to build projects from start to finish to be submitted for judging and prizes. Hackathon events are typically free to attend, with all necessary transportation, venues, chairs, tables, food, electricity, etc. funded by sponsors. Typically sponsors are TECH companies that use the opportunity to circulate their brand with students,organizations, corporate bodies and the general public to seek out hiring candidates, and to encourage innovations. Frequently, sponsors also offer prizes for the best use of their API,technology or platform(eg. IBM might offer a prize for the best use of their cloud services)
result.description:
Preamble
My name is Kingsford Yankson cryptocurrency enthusiasts and an ambassador for smartcash known on discord as @yankdiary.

Background
After the failure of the first proposal, " Building software for the Africa ecosystem of SmartCash", some community members contacted me to bring up the proposal again since the idea behind the proposal was good and can aid in the massive adoption of SmartCash in Africa. Some concerns raised by some community members was that the proposal was not well elaborated for easy understanding in which led to its failure. This is a vivid and restructured proposal of the previous one. We realize that there is a gap between native developers in Africa and blockchain technology (cryptocurrency). For technology like SmartCash whose competency lies on innovative ideas and new technology, we therefore saw that there is the need to bridge that gap.Thinking of what to do we decided to organize a hackathon with workshop and extensive education to integrate this native developers into the ecosystem of SmartCash. We also realize that massive adoption can be achieved in different ways and in different regions taking into consideration the system of transaction pratice in that particular region. For instance the likes of card (debitcard, mastet, smartcard)etc, have contributed well in the massive adoption of SmartCash in Europe and America but when this same system is applied in Africa its hard to yield any result. This is why we want to organize this competition to bring native developers on board who will create softwares to integrate the SmartCash into the way of life of the people (economic culture) but not telling or force them to abandoned theirs completely. That is, we seeking to bring developers onboard to generate and brainstorm ideas that will integrate how the people of Africans spend, save and make day to day fiat transaction into Smartcash ecosystem system. For example, in Ghana over 80% of the total population deals with mobile money banking and transaction and so if a software is been created to include smartcash in this mobile money banking which will make it easy for smartcash users to do transaction day in and day out, then we are not far from achieving massive adoption and usage of smartcash in Ghana.

 

How we will do it
We (my team and I) aim to organize competition for the developers. We are expecting not more than 50 developers and they will be competing for a price in SmartCash

The judges for the competition will be pioneers for smartcash Africa and other Outstanding developers in Africa.

Email and letters have been sent to the various software developers in Ghana and Head of department of the various IT universities to let outstanding developers students to also partake in the competition. The letters were sent to them with the theme of the competition attached to it. This will enable the developers for the competition to get prepare with their innovative ideas to execute.

The theme for this Hackathon is “consumer finance?.” We are challenging them to think of some glaring problem in the consumer finance in Africa that can be solved using blockchain technology.(SmartCash)

For example, perhaps you want to fix peer-to-peer lending or create a way for individuals to fund each others’ mortgages, instead of banks. Or maybe you want to revolutionize how auto loans work using the blockchain technology.

You can build an App that uses blockchain technology to solve a problem in any area of consumer finance in Africa but the problem you choose to solve is up to you!

Workshops
The competition will be integrated with a series of talks, workshops and advice on challenges related with the smartcash platform in Africa, this will be related to integrate new ideas and hacks in the SmartCash platform. This workshop and talk is to enlighten the developers about SmartCash and also educates them on technical issues concerning SmartCash.

This Hackathon will be smartcash branded completely, all participants will receive swag from smartcash with all event and staff wearing the logo of Smartcash.

After the competition teams will show their projects to each other and the judges. They are strongly encouraged to present a demo of what they have built. Pitch or presentation are also encouraged. But they will not be judge base on the quality of the pitch but base on what you have built even if broken or you weren’t able to finish. Completion is only one part of the criteria, they must also present a demo, that is very necessary. Remember, hacking is about building and learning not about selling.

Key Deliverables(Goals)
Give awareness about the development needs for the SmartCash ecosystem in Africa.

Evangelizing developers about the SmartCash project in general and its key learnings to generate impact

Generate important hackers for the SmartCash community

Have fun with hacking in the SmartCash platform

Discover new integrations and development opportunities

Open the SmartCash development in general to the local community

Agenda
Friday 6 PM to Saturday 8:00 PM
Friday
6:00 PM Registration
7:00 PM Opening
8:00 PM Conference 1
9:00 PM Workshop 1
10:00 PM Dinner
11:00 PM Workshop 2
12:00 PM Workshop 3

Saturday
8:00 AM Breakfast
10:00 AM Mentors Panel
11:00 AM Workshop 4
1:00 PM Mentors Panel
4:00 PM Hacks Registration
5:00 PM Hacks Presentation
6:00 PM Hacks Judging
7:00 PM Winners Announcement Awards
8:00 PM Closing Ceremony

Stakeholders

Programmers
I T students
Computer engineers
Graphic designers
General public
Software developers

Activities

Workshops - This would be a series of preparation talks given to the teams that will be participating on the Hackathon, with technical specs.

Hackathon - Programming session will go from x to y pm. Teams will be assembled and coding sessions will go on for the remainder of the day.

Award session - Closing of the event as well as evaluation of the code from Judges and final award to the teams.

Judging session - This will be a space to have the core developers to Judge and participate in the judging session. They will be key part of the winners decision.

Judging criteria for the competition

Technology
How technically impressive was the hack? Was the technical problem the team tackled difficult? Did it use a particularly clever technique or did it use many different components? Did the technology involved make you go “Wow”?

Viability
Does the project has a realistic chance of being implemented by partners? Is the idea scalable and applicable to more industries? Is it realistic to further develop the project?

Originality
Is your project creative, new and innovative? Is it something we already know or is the idea disruptive?

UX
How is the design and user experience of your project? Is it easy to understand and use?

Wow-effect
Can you amaze the judges with new use-cases, big opportunities or surprises? How much did you achieve during the competition

 

Objective(in business terms)
The ROI is very great and enormous to smartcash and its community in Africa at large. Developers will be motivated to code in their own language. The benefits to Smartcash are:

Developer Engagement
The competition will build a bridge to the developer community.
For cryptocurrency like Smartcash whose competencies lie in providing technology solutions, this competition help establish two-way conversations between those that develop the technology (APIs, APKs, data sets etc) and the people that use them. This feedback loop increases developer adoption, which is crucial if solutions are to proliferate across new channels.

 

Corporate Branding
Associating your brand with a competition like this can change the public’s perception of your brand and help acquire developer mindshare. Hosting a competition or getting involved as a sponsor is an efficient way to deliver more awareness about your coin to a prime, target audience – the maker community – and increase brand exposure in the tech world.

IP Development
This competition is great, not necessarily because the silver bullet will be found, but because participants may find something you never knew you were looking for. This may be using your software solutions to break into new markets or developing extensions that open up entire new customer bases.
In addition, participants often not only develop a prototype of an app but frequently its infrastructure as well. This competition can build a genuine business case for the submission that justifies and facilitates further development and investment in the team that provided the solution.

Recruitment
As project-based challenges, this competition come closest to testing a candidate’s capabilities of handling challenges in the workplace.
With software developers and data scientists in high demand, it’s challenging for companies to gain exposure, garner interest and determine the best talent. This competition can address both challenges. It will enable the SmartCash community to gain awareness in the developer community and are perceived as “hacker-friendly”. This helps attract top talent and once the candidates apply, they have at least one project under their belt and have proven to be passionate enough about their work to spend a weekend with little to no sleep. With this, looking for software developers to create software for the ecosystem of SmartCash in the future will be simple.

Justification (success criteria)
Videos and pictures will be sent to the various community of smartcash during when the competition is ongoing. There will be live streaming of the competition on facebook and twitter.
Developers who will show outstanding performance will be introduced to the Smartcash community for further collaborations with other developers of SmartCash.
All code will be uploaded to GITHUB or other public sources for future references.

Communication strategy
I’m on Discord, Facebook, Twitter and SmartCash forum as @Yankdiary
Yanksonkingsford@yahoo.com is my current, active and personal email.

Budget

venue: Renting the venue will need to have AC and good lighting and space with electrical cable to plug in and get wifi. Routers and Wifi equipment will be needed for networking. We will allocate a budget for 50 people
Prizes: first prize $1000, 2nd prize $500 and 3rd prize $200 (all in SmartCash) other souvenirs will also be given to other teams.

Staff : People assisting the teams as well as helping with organization, design, subscriptions recordings and such. We think a staff of 3-5 people. With a budget of 350 USD.

Gear (screen, projectors, banners, etc): We want to make sure SmartCash branding is well represented on the event. We think on 2 smaller banners, bigger one and roll up banner will be enough.

Participant Kit: T-shirt, Pen, Bag , all SmartCash Branded
Also there will be radio/advertisements about the hackathon to also attract top talent and more people to the venue. With this as we are developing we are also doing marketing

Venue $600 for two days

Award for the winners $1700

2 Software Developers and 2 data scientists + 5 Judges. $416

Refreshments $513

Transportation within the region $360

Smartcash shirt, pen, stickers and bag $421

advertising the competition (Radio and Television) $319

Total $5312.1

My team and I aim at extending this project to other Africa countries. But since this is my first project I want to see my performance in this mini project before I roll in another one.
We aim at completing the SmartCash road map which state that developing local base multi currency wallet with trading abilities.

result.title: Introducing SmartCash to Newly Admitted Students of the University of Cape Coast (UCC), Ghana
result.summary: We will introduce SmartCash to the newly admitted students of the 2018/2019 academic year in the University of Cape Coast, Ghana. They are fresh students and do not probably have any idea about cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology. It serves as an opportunity to introduce SmartCash to them as they start their journeys to getting their first degree. We will achieve this through workshops, radio discussions and meet-ups in five different halls of residents within the University. Our main target is newly admitted students because they were not present on campus during previous SmartCash outreach programs. With this project, these fresh students will get exposure and probably invest in SmartCash before getting to know of other alt-coins thereby giving SmartCash the First Mover Advantage.
result.description:
Who am I?

I am Alhassan Abdul Basit on facebook ((https://web.facebook.com/alhassan.abdulbasit.77) and @Mr. SmartCash on the SmartCash Discord community. I am a graduand in Bachelor of Commerce and a campus ambassador of SmartCash in the University of Cape Coast. I am currently a service personnel at the School of Business in the University. Ever since I had exposure to SmartCash, I have always been a SmartCash advocate because I believe that SmartCash is the future and a real example of a 21st century currency because of its incentivized and decentralized nature. I have worked with some SmartCash advocates in Ghana and I strongly believe that I can play an active role in expanding the SmartCash community base by intensively promoting SmartCash inside the University of Cape Coast and beyond.

What do we want to bring on board?

Our aim is to ensure massive adoption and usability of SmartCash within the University community by organizing conferences/seminars in all five (5) selected halls of residents including radio discussions on campus to educate and practically train fresh University students, hall administrators, hall bursars, merchants, e.t.c. on cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology especially SmartCash. This project will target fresh students at hall levels due to the large size of the University with geographically dispersed students.

This will help trigger the invasion of SmartCash as a generally accepted medium of exchange and also educate students on all the benefits and merits of using SmartCash against other cryptocurrencies. Our main target is newly admitted students because they were not present on campus during previous SmartCash outreach programs.

Do you want to know more about the University of Cape Coast (UCC)?

The University of Cape Coast (https://www.ucc.edu.gh/aboutus/about-ucc) is one of the largest tertiary institutions in Ghana, West Africa, with an incremental annual enrollment status of about 15,650 students. The university, which is five kilometers west of Cape Coast, is on a hill overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. It operates on two campuses: the Southern Campus (Old Site) and the Northern Campus (New Site). The University is very large with geographically dispersed students. Fresh students reside in Halls while continuing students live in hostels within the University community.

The large numbers of students that graduate every year from this University and other Ghanaian Universities create a lot of competition in the job market which leaves a lot of graduates unemployed after their University education. Due to the fear of being unemployed after school, students are now developing insatiable appetite for entrepreneurship while tertiary institutions are now establishing platforms to encourage innovation, creativity as well as job creation after school. Just like any other platforms that incite creative ideas, the SmartHive proposal projects and other investment opportunities on SmartCash provide absolutely excellent opportunities for students to pursue their goals of attaining financial freedom after school. This provides a good reason to introduce SmartCash to these fresh University students as they start their journeys to getting their first degree.

The good news is that most University students have laptops and smart phones and are actively involved in conversations on social media platforms such as WhatsApp, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Also, First year students reside in Halls with wireless internet connection which creates room for all-day internet connectivity. These serve as opportunities to introduce cryptocurrencies especially SmartCash to these fresh students since they have the needed devices and facilities to join the incentivized and decentralized community.

What is our action plan?

All participants of the project will be educated about cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology. They will also be given exclusive education and training on SmartCash, how to set up wallets and ways they can also contribute to the incentivized and decentralized community through proposal writing on the SmartHive. The education and training outline for participants is detailed below:

  • 30 minutes radio discussion on Blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies with much emphasis on SmartCash and why it is preferred to other cryptocurrencies. We will utilize the campus radio (http://www.atlfmonline.com/ ) since it is located inside the University. The radio discussion will have coverage of about 40,000 people with calls in sessions.
  • SmartCash WhatsApp/Facebook groups shall be created for each hall of residence where members in the same hall can share their knowledge on SmartCash.
  • At the seminars/workshops, all participants will be given a general education on the Blockchain technology and crypto currencies. They will be lectured on SmartCash and given practical training on how to set up SmartCash wallets and its features, how to send/receive SmartCash, buying/selling SmartCash on local exchanges and the merits of choosing SmartCash over other Crypto Currencies. Participants will also be educated on why they should invest in SmartCash with respect to SmartRewards and SmartHive projects.
  • Participants will also be guided on how to develop ideas and proposals that can promote the SmartCash agenda.
  • Participants who prove serious and interested in the idea of SmartCash will be chosen as representatives of SmartCash in each of the halls of residence.
  • Hall administrators, bursars, merchants, businesses and hall executives in each hall will also be involved. Bursars will be educated on why they should accept payments in SmartCash.

Are we informed enough to educate others about SmartCash?

It is important to note that whether someone accepts SmartCash or not depends on how the person is introduced to it. If the person gets a good and understandable introduction, they are more likely to accept SmartCash. Apart from the training acquired during the SmartCash outreach programs as ambassadors, we have done our homework and extensive research on cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology especially SmartCash just to get a better understanding of what we are about to market to others.

Also, to ensure effectiveness and success in ‘winning more souls to SmartCash’, we have formed a team made up of students from different cultural, academic and religious backgrounds so as to overcome the problem of groupthink associated with lack of diversity. It is also important to note that we have students from humanities, social sciences and arts that can impact in making this project a success by pooling expertise from marketing, journalism, public relations, event management, human relations and many more.

Timeline for the project:

The education and training will be held in five (5) different halls of residents with a first year student population of about 1050  each. The following are the principal halls of residents in the University and the timeline for each hall:

Valco Hall (http://valcohall.com/history/)                                                                               1st Week

Kwame Nkrumah Hall (https://ucc.edu.gh/content/kwame-nkrumah-hall)                                 2nd Week

Casley Hayford Hall (https://casfordhall.wordpress.com/)                                                        3rd Week         

Oguaa Hall (https://oguaahall.blogspot.com/)                                                                         4th Week

Atlantic Hall (https://web.facebook.com/Atlantic-Hall-UCC-131390203617595/?_rdc=1&_rdr)     5th Week                 

 

Proposal Budget:

Transportation to halls within the University                                                 $300                                       

Hiring Venue for five Workshops/Seminars                                                   $600                                       

Refreshments for all Participants in five Halls                                               $400                                       

SmartCash T-shirts for participants in all 5 Halls                                          $600                                       

Tokens for Participants in SMARTS                                                              $250                                      

30minutes radio discussion                                                                        $100                                       

Communication, Hall publicity platforms, data calls                                      $150                                                   

Photographer/Cameraman for five Seminars                                                $250                                                   

Banner, stickers, fliers for Workshops                                                          $150                                       

Sub-Total                                                                                                $2800                                     

Contingency (5% * 2800)                                                                           $140                                       

GRAND TOTAL                                                                                         $2940                                     

We are therefore asking for $2940/equivalent number of SMARTS to carry out this project.

 

How do we Account to the SmartCash community?

  • Updates will be posted to SmartCash discord community each week for all Five Seminars/Workshops for the five weeks’ time period.
  • Photos, Videos and reports will be compiled and posted to the Community, Facebook and other Social media platforms as ads.
  • Team members are well informed, committed and dedicated to promoting SmartCash on Campus and Ghana at large.

result.title: Smartcash Argentina - Developer Researchers - Growing Big Startup Community
result.summary:
What will we do to reach our goals?

Information:

We will spread information about Smartcash and its advantages compared to other cryptocurrencies and our FIAT money system in Spanish speaking countries through Cowork Ambassadors. (Argentina)

By doing so we will get the attention of our target groups (early adopter from trade, gastronomy, finance, politics, decision makers, entrepreneurs). They will be interested in Smartcash so we can create the desire of a better world that can be satisfied by an action our target groups can take on their own: accepting Smartcash as a means of payment in their businesses and daily lives. 

The only thing we need to do to help them with this is...
result.description:
Education:

Therefore we will offer services like

  • E-Learning Tool for ambassadors.
    People who want to help educating people about Smartcash, need to be trained before, so we can make sure that everybody talking about Smartcash as an “Official Smartcash Coworker Ambassador” is spreading the truth.
  • Cowork Ambassador network
    2 cities, 3 coworkspace, 9 Smartcash Ambassadors doing presentations and workshops on a monthly base by using official Smartcash presentations and marketing materials. (Buenos Aires, Cordoba).
  • Workshops (monthly base) with trusted partners from the cryptoverse, such as Criptnoticias, INVOT, Cryptolancers.
  • Webinar (weekly base) including report of the conference.


Once people are well educated about our money system and the possibilities Smartcash has to offer they may take the next step, which is called...

Integration

To help them with this we will provide a 

  • Merchant Support Center, which will help merchants with the integration via Live Chat, on the phone, via shared screen or if necessary in person


Website

All this needs a home. This is why we will setup a Smartcash Buenos Aires Website including the following pages

  • Smartcash(general information)
  • Embassy (info and team)
  • Projects (blog about everything we do)
  • Events (schedule and registration)
  • Support (information livechat and contact form)
  • FAQ (everything people will ask us answered)


DAO Structure and Team

The legal structure of this DAO has yet to be cleared by our tax accountants and lawyers to provide maximum ownership of it by the Smartcash network. It will be a vivid and long-term development.

We will start with a five divisions structure to provide a high grade of decentralized and focused work via microsoft teams, officer planner and discord. 

These are our divisions and division leaders:

 Marketing and Information
Budget, Administration and Law.
Website, Newsletter and Social Media
Integration and Support
Education

We will constantly add contractors from the Buenos Aires region to fulfill our growing needs of the DAO and provide maximum outreach.


Reporting

Smartcash community will have access to the collaboration and project management tools we are using, so they can help us to keep you updated all the time.


Timeline

The timings aren´t finished yet, because we are waiting for some external information and timings might change over time, but this will give you a first overview: 3 Conference in September


We will be in contact with Smartcash official developers to receive updates and support for the tasks we are working on (CI, CD, POS integration, ...) and will keep Smartcash forum and Discord News updated all the time.

Further detailed information about the monthly funding will be provided by us in the next weeks via an accounting link and reports written by Smartcash Buenos Aires Cowork team as we will provide maximum transparency of our costs structure to the Smartcash community.

 

 Proposal Owner

Hello Smartcash Community my name is Manuel Arthan(@disruptgab), I know I'm new to the Smartcash community but I've been working with tech communities for the past 4 years and our team have been involved with the organization of almost 10 Blockchain Conference all over Argentina and Latin America, I have the fortune to have a great team and we would like to help spread Smartcash to our dev community.

Please read along and please ask any questions.


Objective

  • Give awareness about the development needs for the Smartcash Platform
  • Evangelize developers about the Smartcash Project in General and key learnings to generate impact
  • Generate important hacks for the Smartcash community
  • Have fun with hacking in the Smartcash platform
  • Discover new integrations and development opportunities
  • Open the Smartcash development in general to the local community
 
 

About Smartcash Buenos Aires

The first legal Latin-Americanhub open-source Smartcash company. It is incorporated in Argentina and is a new kind of Smartcash Sub-DAO, which is acting as an entire professional marketing, education, integration, develop and support service agency for Smartcash with a legal network of well-known crypto experienced law firms behind it. The overall goal is to increase the acceptance of Smartcash as a means of payment by increasing the Smartcash Eco-System with partnerships and cooperation’s. As a Sub-DAO it represents the clear efforts to push Smartcash as soon as possible to mass adoption.

We want to promote Smartcash, Smarthive dynamics & blockchain technology adoption around local entrepreneurs and startups showing how they can benefit from it by organizing meetups and small events, also we want to manage a entrepreneur contest with a Smart prize to raise the awareness of the locals about smartcash community and open an office for longterm adoption.

Smartcash cowork ambassadors.

It will be a group of enthusiasts of disruptive technology and cryptocurrencies focused on Smartcash adoption, integration and commercialization distributed in different entreprenurial communities and markerspace with the objective of reaching out to enthusiast workers and freelancers to form a team with the following skills.

Marketing team.

In charge of designing digital marketing strategies focused on Smartcash adoption in Argentina.

Developers

In charge of developing infrastructure and integration platforms to facilitate the use of Smartcash and satisfy the needs of merchants and entrepreneurs in Argentina. Their main goal is to elaborate libraries to integrate Smartcash on blockchain solutions hosters on the cloud.

Project managers.

In charge of encouraging the startup community to start blockchain related projects and adopt Smartcash technology and being advisors to them.

At first, they will be distributed in these three networks and cowork spaces:

Urbanstation

Cespedes

Impacthub Buenos Aires

Full Budget

result.title: Smartcash sport fiesta
result.summary:
The Smartcash sport fiesta has a major aim of bringing about mass adoption and creating awareness about Smartcash and cryptocurrency through a blend of sports and cryptocurrency. 
The fiesta will host student from three tertiary institutions from the northern region of Nigeria coming together to hold friendly competition and learn about cryptocurrency.
result.description:
HOW WE INTEND TO ACHIEVE THIS:
I and my team will be hosting inter-tertiary sports competition including
basket ball, scrabble and chess amongst three tertiary institutions and videos of the events will be uploaded on our social media platforms also we will have journalist and bloggers write about the event and media stations air the event thereby reaching out to over a 100,000 Nigerians.
We will be giving out Smartcash crested medals to participants and winners in the sports,smartcash handbooks with detailed information about cryptocurrency,features of Smartcash and what they need to know about Smartcash. Also there will be fliers to enable non verbal outreach.
HOW WE WILL GO ABOUT IT:
We will have three schools compete against each other while learning about cryptocurrency.by so doing we will not only reach out to the participants involved but also to others students and spectators in the event.Also the journalists, bloggers, and media stations present will further boost our outreach by writing about Smartcash and the event in their blogs and airing it in the channels.
INTRODUCTION
I am Blessing Nathaniel a cryptocurrency enthusiast, scrabble coach, public speaker and marketer . I got to know about cryptocurrrency since 2016 and have ever since been passionate about it and evangelising about it at every slight opportunity. I am a member of the community on discord and steemit and have been contributing my quota,i raised a proposal some months back which didn’t pass but still I wasn’t deterred because I am looking at the bigger picture . I got drawn to smart cash because of it community support system and am here to stay.

Smart Cash will obtain thousand audiences through the sports fiesta and also from the activity being aired and further publications by bloggers and journalists online.

result.title: Building software for the Africa ecosystem of SmartCash
result.summary:
The adoption of Africa seem different from other parts of the world and other continent. The kind of software and marketing ideas that work well in Other parts of the world may seem not to function well down here. This project seeks to promote SmartCash ecosystem and technology and also to bring new computer engineers, software developers, programmers and other stakeholders to build new software to help move the massive adoption in Africa at a faster pace.This project also seek to bring developers together to compete for a price so that their project innovations and ideas will be used for further development
For those of as who are not familiar with hackathon, is an event where a group of individuals gather for 24-48 hours to build projects from start to finish to be submitted for judging and prizes. Hackathon events are typically free to attend, with all necessary transportation, venues, chairs, tables, food, electricity, etc. funded by sponsors. Typically sponsors are TECH companies that use the opportunity to circulate their brand with students,organizations, corporate bodies and the general public to seek out hiring candidates, and to encourage innovations. Frequently, sponsors also offer prizes for the best use of their API,technology or platform(eg. IBM might offer a prize for the best use of their cloud service)
result.description:
Preamble
My name is Kingsford Yankson cryptocurrency enthusiasts and an ambassador for smartcash known on discord as @yankdiary.

Background
After the failure of the first proposal, " Building software for the Africa ecosystem of SmartCash", some community members contacted me to bring up the proposal again since the idea behind the proposal was good and can aid in the massive adoption of SmartCash in Africa. Some concerns raised by some community members was that the proposal was not well elaborated for easy understanding in which led to its failure. This is a vivid and restructured proposal of the previous one. We realize that there is a gap between native developers in Africa and blockchain technology (cryptocurrency). For technology like SmartCash whose competency lies on innovative ideas and new technology, we therefore saw that there is the need to bridge that gap.Thinking of what to do we decided to organize a hackathon with workshop and extensive education to integrate this native developers into the ecosystem of SmartCash. We also realize that massive adoption can be achieved in different ways and in different regions taking into consideration the system of transaction pratice in that particular region. For instance the likes of card (debitcard, mastet, smartcard)etc, have contributed well in the massive adoption of SmartCash in Europe and America but when this same system is applied in Africa its hard to yield any result. This is why we want to organize this competition to bring native developers on board who will create softwares to integrate the SmartCash into the way of life of the people (economic culture) but not telling or force them to abandoned theirs completely. That is, we seeking to bring developers onboard to generate and brainstorm ideas that will integrate how the people of Africans spend, save and make day to day fiat transaction into Smartcash ecosystem system. For example, in Ghana over 80% of the total population deals with mobile money banking and transaction and so if a software is been created to include smartcash in this mobile money banking which will make it easy for smartcash users to do transaction day in and day out, then we are not far from achieving massive adoption and usage of smartcash in Ghana.

 

How we will do it
We (my team and I) aim to organize competition for the developers. We are expecting not more than 50 developers and they will be competing for a price in SmartCash

The judges for the competition will be pioneers for smartcash Africa and other Outstanding developers in Africa.

Email and letters have been sent to the various software developers in Ghana and Head of department of the various IT universities to let outstanding developers students to also partake in the competition. The letters were sent to them with the theme of the competition attached to it. This will enable the developers for the competition to get prepare with their innovative ideas to execute.

The theme for this Hackathon is “consumer finance?.” We are challenging them to think of some glaring problem in the consumer finance in Africa that can be solved using blockchain technology.(SmartCash)

For example, perhaps you want to fix peer-to-peer lending or create a way for individuals to fund each others’ mortgages, instead of banks. Or maybe you want to revolutionize how auto loans work using the blockchain technology.

You can build an App that uses blockchain technology to solve a problem in any area of consumer finance in Africa but the problem you choose to solve is up to you!

Workshops
The competition will be integrated with a series of talks, workshops and advice on challenges related with the smartcash platform in Africa, this will be related to integrate new ideas and hacks in the SmartCash platform. This workshop and talk is to enlighten the developers about SmartCash and also educates them on technical issues concerning SmartCash.

This Hackathon will be smartcash branded completely, all participants will receive swag from smartcash with all event and staff wearing the logo of Smartcash.

After the competition teams will show their projects to each other and the judges. They are strongly encouraged to present a demo of what they have built. Pitch or presentation are also encouraged. But they will not be judge base on the quality of the pitch but base on what you have built even if broken or you weren’t able to finish. Completion is only one part of the criteria, they must also present a demo, that is very necessary. Remember, hacking is about building and learning not about selling.

Key Deliverables(Goals)
Give awareness about the development needs for the SmartCash ecosystem in Africa.

Evangelizing developers about the SmartCash project in general and its key learnings to generate impact

Generate important hackers for the SmartCash community

Have fun with hacking in the SmartCash platform

Discover new integrations and development opportunities

Open the SmartCash development in general to the local community

Technology
How technically impressive was the hack? Was the technical problem the team tackled difficult? Did it use a particularly clever technique or did it use many different components? Did the technology involved make you go “Wow”?

Viability
Does the project has a realistic chance of being implemented by partners? Is the idea scalable and applicable to more industries? Is it realistic to further develop the project?

Originality
Is your project creative, new and innovative? Is it something we already know or is the idea disruptive?

UX
How is the design and user experience of your project? Is it easy to understand and use?

Wow-effect
Can you amaze the judges with new use-cases, big opportunities or surprises? How much did you achieve during the competition

 

Objective(in business terms)
The ROI is very great and enormous to smartcash and its community in Africa at large. Developers will be motivated to code in their own language. The benefits to Smartcash are:

Developer Engagement
The competition will build a bridge to the developer community.
For cryptocurrency like Smartcash whose competencies lie in providing technology solutions, this competition help establish two-way conversations between those that develop the technology (APIs, APKs, data sets etc) and the people that use them. This feedback loop increases developer adoption, which is crucial if solutions are to proliferate across new channels.

 

Corporate Branding
Associating your brand with a competition like this can change the public’s perception of your brand and help acquire developer mindshare. Hosting a competition or getting involved as a sponsor is an efficient way to deliver more awareness about your coin to a prime, target audience – the maker community – and increase brand exposure in the tech world.

IP Development
This competition is great, not necessarily because the silver bullet will be found, but because participants may find something you never knew you were looking for. This may be using your software solutions to break into new markets or developing extensions that open up entire new customer bases.
In addition, participants often not only develop a prototype of an app but frequently its infrastructure as well. This competition can build a genuine business case for the submission that justifies and facilitates further development and investment in the team that provided the solution.

Recruitment
As project-based challenges, this competition come closest to testing a candidate’s capabilities of handling challenges in the workplace.
With software developers and data scientists in high demand, it’s challenging for companies to gain exposure, garner interest and determine the best talent. This competition can address both challenges. It will enable the SmartCash community to gain awareness in the developer community and are perceived as “hacker-friendly”. This helps attract top talent and once the candidates apply, they have at least one project under their belt and have proven to be passionate enough about their work to spend a weekend with little to no sleep. With this, looking for software developers to create software for the ecosystem of SmartCash in the future will be simple.

Developers who will show outstanding performance will be introduced to the Smartcash community for further collaborations with other developers of SmartCash.

result.title: Building software for the Africa ecosystem of SmartCash (Hackathon).  Restructured
result.summary:
The adoption of Africa seem different from other parts of the world and other continent. The kind of software and marketing ideas that work well in Other parts of the world may seem not to function well down here. This project seeks to promote SmartCash ecosystem and technology and also to bring new computer engineers, software developers, programmers and other stakeholders to build new software to help move the massive adoption of SmartCash in Africa at a faster pace.This project also seek to bring developers together to compete  so that their project, innovations and ideas will be used and or bought for further development
For those of as who are not familiar with hackathon, is an event where a group of individuals gather for 24-48 hours to build projects from start to finish to be submitted for judging and prizes. Hackathon events are typically free to attend, with all necessary transportation, venues, chairs, tables, food, electricity, etc. funded by sponsors. Typically sponsors are TECH companies that use the opportunity to circulate their brand with students,organizations, corporate bodies and the general public to seek out hiring candidates, and to encourage innovations. Frequently, sponsors also offer prizes for the best use of their API,technology or platform(eg. IBM might offer a prize for the best use of their cloud service)

My name is Kingsford Yankson cryptocurrency enthusiasts and an ambassador for smartcash known on discord as @yankdiary.

Background
After the failure of the first proposal, " Building software for the Africa ecosystem of SmartCash", some community members contacted me to bring up the proposal again since the idea behind the proposal was good and can aid in the massive adoption of SmartCash in Africa. Some concerns raised by some community members was that the proposal was not well elaborated for easy understanding in which led to its failure. This is a vivid and restructured proposal of the previous one. We realize that there is a gap between native developers in Africa and blockchain technology (cryptocurrency). For technology like SmartCash whose competency lies on innovative ideas and new technology, we therefore saw that there is the need to bridge that gap.Thinking of what to do we decided to organize a hackathon with workshop and extensive education to integrate this native developers into the ecosystem of SmartCash. We also realize that massive adoption can be achieved in different ways and in different regions taking into consideration the system of transaction pratice in that particular region. For instance the likes of card (debitcard, mastet, smartcard)etc, have contributed well in the massive adoption of SmartCash in Europe and America but when this same system is applied in Africa its hard to yield any result. This is why we want to organize this competition to bring native developers on board who will create softwares to integrate the SmartCash into the way of life of the people (economic culture) but not telling or force them to abandoned theirs completely. That is, we seeking to bring developers onboard to generate and brainstorm ideas that will integrate how the people of Africans spend, save and make day to day fiat transaction into Smartcash ecosystem system. For example, in Ghana over 80% of the total population deals with mobile money banking and transaction and so if a software is been created to include smartcash in this mobile money banking which will make it easy for smartcash users to do transaction day in and day out,(eg swift from SmatCash to fiat and fiat to SmatCash easily without any difficulties) then we are not far from achieving massive adoption and usage of smartcash in Ghana.

 

How we will do it
We (my team and I) aim to organize competition for the developers. We are expecting not more than 50 developers and they will be competing for a price in SmartCash

The judges for the competition will be pioneers for smartcash Africa and other Outstanding developers in Africa.

result.title: Smartcash Sports competition
result.summary: sports are a powerful tool that brings people together and creates a sense of community. They develop connections that bond together people from all walks of life. For a long time, sports have been viewed as a way to stay healthy and in shape, but their importance goes much further. As a matter of fact, playing sports teaches life lessons like discipline, responsibility, self-confidence, accountability, and teamwork.
result.description:
OBJECTIVE:
The Smartcash sport fiesta has a major aim of bringing about mass adoption and creating awareness about Smartcash and cryptocurrency through a blend of sports and cryptocurrency.
The fiesta will host student from three tertiary institutions from the northern region of Nigeria coming together to hold friendly competition and learn about cryptocurrency.
HOW WE INTEND TO ACHIEVE THIS:
I and my team will be hosting inter-tertiary sports competition including
basket ball, scrabble and chess and videos of the events will be uploaded on our social media platforms also we will have bloggers  write about the event thereby reaching out to over a 100,000 Nigerians.
We will be giving out medals to participants and winners in the sports,smartcash handbooks with detailed information about cryptocurrency,features of Smartcash and what they need to know about Smartcash. Also there will be fliers to enable non verbal outreach.
HOW WE WILL GO ABOUT IT:
We will have three schools compete against each other while learning about cryptocurrency.by so doing we will not only reach out to the participants involved but also to others students and spectators in the event.Also the bloggers present will further boost our outreach by writing about Smartcash and the event in their blog .
INTRODUCTION
I am Blessing Nathaniel a cryptocurrency evangelist,a public speaker, scrabble coach and a marketer. I got to know about cryptocurrrency since 2016 and have ever since been passionate about it and evangelising about it at every slight opportunity. I am a member of the community on discord and steemit and have been contributing my quota,i raised a proposal some months back which didn’t pass but still I wasn’t deterred because I am looking at the bigger picture . I got drawn to smart cash because of it community support system and am here to stay.
How will our activity benefit SMART CASH?
Smart Cash will obtain thousand audiences through the sports fiesta and also from further publications by bloggers online.
Smartcash will gain new investors. We are going to attract young folks who will be able to
promote Smartcash efficiently.
Smart cash will get our team as a long term solid partners with rich experience in crypto-
currency adoptions strategies, business and marketing on the Nigeria markets.
Our next step is to promote Smartcash deeper and deeper into our community and institutions
BUDGET
Transportation for the three schools to the competition venue =$1000
Smartcash Banner/pull-ups 5by10 =$200
Smart shirts $10*50=$500

Smartcash medals =$500

media publication =$500
Smarthandbooks $5*20=$100

fliers $1*100=$100
Crested Smart jerseys=$800
Photography =$50

videography $50 perhr(3hrs)=$150

Administrative cost=$500
Sub Total=$4400

result.title: SmartCash Reward System Using My Resteem Service On Steemit
result.summary: My resteem service aims at leveraging on its large number of followers to increase the popularity and quicken adoption of SMARTCASH on steemit.
result.description:
> **INTRODUCTION**

Abasinkanga Resteem Service (@abasinkanga) on steemit.com has 6700 followers as at the time of writing this proposal, 5 to 20 new followers are added to my account on a daily basis through my regular resteems, and posting comments on resteemed posts along with other promotional efforts to make the resteem service the most popular resteem service on steemit.

**My resteem service aims at leveraging on its large number of followers to increase the popularity and quicken adoption of SMARTCASH on steemit.**

> **About Abasinkanga Resteem Service:**

The standard fee for a post resteem is 0.1 SBD. We have a discord server

> **My contribution to SMARTCASH growth so far:**

I started the Smartcash reward for resteem service since the 1st of May, 2018. Within that period a total of 391 smarts was distributed as follows:
May: 128 smarts
June: 129 smarts
July: 134 smarts so far

Visit link to see proof that i actually do carry out these resteems and reward smartcash accordingly. Historical link to reports for the month of July are found at the bottom of the post here:
https://steemit.com/smartcash/@abasinkanga/100-report-my-resteem-service-gives-you-a-daily-passive-income-with-each-post-you-resteem-sunday-22nd-monday-23rd-july-2018

> **My Proposal for SmartCash:**

* Every steemit user that pays me for a post resteem should be rewarded SMARTCASH (1 SMART per post resteemed)
* A comment stating the user has received a smartcash reward for using my resteem service, and command menus for accessing his smartcash will be made on his post.

* I am requesting that the smartcash community approve a total of 600 smartcash for a 3 months campaign of resteeming smartcash posts.
* A total of +/-200 smartcash is budgeted for each month, but depending on requests from steemit users (those who pay for resteems), we may actually spend less than or more than that each month.
* After the 3 months period, this proposal should be reviewed, and if necessary an upward or downward review of smartcash amount allocated per month, should be approved and disbursed for another 3 months campaign.

**Breakdown of Proposal Implementation Costs:**
1. Cost of promoting "Smartcash For Resteem" posts with other resteem services
other resteem services charge between 0.05 SBD and 0.2 SBD to resteem posts. I will bear the cost of running promotions for my resteem service, as my own contribution to the success of this proposal

2. Cost of rewarding users smartcash for using my resteem service:
The 1st campaign is for 3 months, I anticipate 200 posts, more or less, will be resteemed each month.
1st month: 150 smartcash allocation
2nd month: 200 smartcash allocation
3rd month: 250 smartcash allocation
Total: 600 smartcash allocation for the 1st campaign


> Smartcash SBD/Steem Exchange Rate

As at Thursday 9th August, 2018
1 Smart = 0.058 USD
1 Smart = 0.053 Steem
1 Smart = 0.054 SBD


> **How Word About SmartCash Will Be Spread On Steemit**

Strategy 1: I will spread the word on steemit about the smartcash income opportunity my resteem service provides by posting 2 to 3 times daily about it, and also i will employ the use of other popular resteem services, to get my posts seen by their own audiences and followers.

Strategy 2: I run a discord server for my resteem service. I have 200 members currently in my server. Steemit users who like my resteem service and want to get more value out of it, when they join my discord server, are also introduced to more smartcash opportunities and the smartcash community on discord.

> **Benefits for SmartCash**

Putting SMARTCASH in the hands of many steemit users using my resteem service as the point of distribution, will make many people to pick extra interest in SmartCash, and increase its adoption rate throughout the steemit platform, because the people receiving SmartCash rewards for using my resteem service, will ultimately want to cash in on the SmartCash rewards they have received. In the process, they will also come to learn about the inherent value that lies in SmartCash and begin to embrace it wholly, starting with joining the smartcash community.

Promoting the "Smartcash For Resteem" service actively on steemit, will be creating more value for smartcash in the long run, as more people know about smartcash and its rewards through my resteem service and this will build further interest in them about smartcash

> **IN CONCLUSION**

I beleive that if this proposal is supported and approved, all steemit users who use my resteem service will adopt SmartCash, in less than 30 days of receiving steady rewards. I predict a 100% conversion rates from non-smartcash users to full smartcash users for every steemit user receiving SmartCash rewards through my resteem service, and also many more people will become aware of smartcash as a rewarding cryptocurrency and payment coin.

Your comments on this proposal will be highly appreciated, constructive or critical, it will be accepted in all fairness. Thank you!

result.title: EXPANDING OUTREACH, BUSINESS ADOPTION AND SMARTCARD AWARENESS
result.summary:
This proposal seek to basically cover the remaining regions I couldn’t cover with my roadshow.
Since the beginning of my smartcash work I have received numerous calls in relation to smartcash from all over Ghana requesting for smartcash meetup in their region and that made me so passionate to always work for smartcash. This proposal will expand the smartcash community in Ghana and Africa and also unveil the all the new awesome features releases to attract potential investors and increase the use case. continuous outreach and sensitization will in no doubt make smartcash popular in Ghana and Africa as a whole. There is currently 4 locations where smartcash users can spend their smartcash and that is the first of its kind in Africa.
result.description:
INTRODUCTION
Ghana is one of the Africa nation where smartcash is growing both merchant adoption and going mainstream as a results of numerous projects that the SmartCash community has funded. SmartCash can be viewed as one of the popular digital currencies in Ghana listed on one of the top crypto/fiat exchange (ebitcoinics.com) and this is as a result of several events carried out by various SmartCash ambassadors in Ghana.

SmartCash is the 5th digital currency to have the Ghanaian cede and naira trading pair on one of the popular fiat exchanges in Ghana.

Currently four (4) businesses accept SmartCash for exchange of goods and services in Ghana and the first country in Africa. This can be attributed to the SmartCash superior POS system over other traditional PoS such as Visa and MasterCard. Businesses that accept SmartCash include ACCRA LUXURY LODGE, BAMFO HOTEL, 3JET SUPPER MARKET and NORTHWIND TECHNOLOGIES with others been in the pipe-line. Jowato.com, an e-commerce website will soon accept SmartCash on their website for shopping. This proposal seek to expand outreach, business adoption and smartcard and signup more businesses in Ghana

This proposal will focus on the western region of Ghana that is currently turning into a hub for both foreign and local investors as a result of oil discovery in the region. The proposal seek to follow similar pattern to the SmartCash roadshow that have been successful in six regions of Ghana. However this has been restructured to minimize cost and maximize output

This proposal will also focus much on getting more people to sign up for SmartCard, onboard businesses and increase the SmartCash use case in Ghana and Africa as a whole.

Several tools such as radio, television interviews and social media campaign will be employed to make the proposal achieve its goal.

OBJECTIVES

  1. Expand the smartcash community in Ghana
  2. Increase smartcash user base through smartcard
  3. Signup more businesses

ACTION PLAN
We will hold 1 hour radio talk to give detail explanation to over 100000 people in the western region

  1. We will have a meet up with diverse group of people from the region to educate them about smartcash and demonstrate to them how to create wallet and buy from exchanges

  2. We will have an hour TV discussion on JOYNEWS TV which will be repeated for more people to view
    .

  3. We will help participants to create smartcard, print for them with our printer and how to use the card

  4. We will training interested participants to further expand outreach in this region and beyond

WHAT WE HAVE DONE
we have done a lot of activities through our roadshow and evidence can be found in the following links:

  1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yf3XThZstic
  2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jWhnQTePCi0
  3. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fJJOgcfUfoM
  4. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1GTjfdX-Mo4
  5. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XQblrdRpcS8&t=384s
  6. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CWzmNIOkd44&t=32s
  7. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ULbd3JzIOw&t=226s
  8. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Swrjr9BoFfw&t=1625s
  9. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ai6wNP-fEoo&t=727s
  10. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bkgfZjTSjiQ
    MODE OF ASSESSMENT:
    1. The community will receive updates both pictures and videos on our YouTube, twitter and Facebook.

result.title: 2 million Brazilians knowing Smartcash - Marketing in Brazil
result.summary: This project intends to obtain resources to invest in marketing for Smartcash in Brazil, developing videos and banners to divulge in the main sources of information of Brazilians who invest, or can invest in Smartcash. The focus will be on Instagram and aims to reach 2,000,000 Brazilians.
result.description:
Our cryptomoeda has many differentials. This is not news to people who get involved in the Smartcash community. However, for our currency to grow it needs to reach as many investors as possible and potential investors. It is at this moment that this project intends to enter. Use the feature received by SmartHive to conduct marketing from Instagram to Brazilians.

 

We will develop arts and videos to publish sponsored on Instagram. The amounts involved in this project will serve to produce the materials and pay the advertising to reach the largest number of people with the investment profile.

 

It is important to consider that, in addition to all the online visibility that this project will bring, other factors show the importance of this investment in Digital Marketing: it will help build a qualified audience for Smartcash and still deliver real and measurable results.

 

In general, we will aim to reach more than 2,000,000 Brazilians and that the posts are viewed (impressions) at least 5,000,000 times.

 

As positive points, it is important to realize that this project has advantages such as: Strengthening the image with the Brazilian public that has investment potential; Speak to the right audience at the right time; To leave in front of the other criptomoedas who never made investments; Analyze results accurately.

 

As a strategy for this project, the online marketing funnel will be considered:

  • 10 sponsored posts will be carried out to reach the Visitor profile that will last 2 months of action.
  • After this period, there will be another 10 posts to reach people with the Lead profile. The goal is that during the previous 10 posts it is possible to bring a number of people from the visitor profile to the Lead profile.
  • Hold another 10 posts so investors see Smartcash as an investment opportunity.
  • Finally, 10 more posts to try to convert those interested in customers.

 

In this universe of 40 posts, some will be in art and others in videos. In the advertisements of Instagram it is imagined to direct the reached public to the site of the Smartcash.

 

 

The value established in this project will serve to pay the posts in Instagram as well as the production of some materials.

 

 

The Brazilian numbers on Instagram:

  • 70% of companies use Instagram
  • 30% of users have already purchased products they have seen on Instagram
  • 80% of users interact with at least one brand
  • More than 1 million users visited a site from Instagram
  • Brazil has more than 57 million active users on Instagram
  • Instagram is the favorite social network of Brazilians with 47.1% of the votes, while Facebook has 29.1%.
  • Most Brazilian users are between 18 and 40 years old, even the target audience of Smartcash.

 

 

Milestone 01 - Approval of Visitors' Posts - US $ 1,500.00 - 09/03/2018

Milestone 02 - 10 visitor messages - $ 11,000.00 - 9/17/2018

Milestone 03 - Approval of posts for Leads - $ 1,500.00 - 9/24/2018

Milestone 04 - 10 posts for Leads - $ 11,000.00 - 10/15/2018

Milestone 05 - Approval of posts for Potential Investors - $ 1,500.00 - 10/30/2018

Milestone 06 - 10 posts for potential investors - $ 11,000.00 - 11/20/2018

Milestone 07 - Approval of posts for Customers - $ 1,500.00 - 12/01/2018

Milestone 08 - 10 posts for Customers - $ 11,000.00 - 12/20/2018

Total = US $ 50,000.00

result.title: BLOCKCHAIN CONGRESS “DISRUPTIVE IDEAS” + SMARTCASH BUSINESS ROUND + DEBATES
result.summary:
We plan to expand the Smartcash community in Lara – Venezuela, through the realization of an 8-hour conference, where through 9 presentations the attendees will deepen on the benefits of Fintech, and expand their knowledge on SmartCash as a secure alternative for payment transactions and investment means. In addition, there will be an entrepreneurship fair, where more than 25 Startup from all over the country will be summoned, which jointly with the Industrial Chambers Federation and Chamber of Commerce  will have a business round being the fundamental premise the use of SmartCash. 

To complete the activity, student and academic sectors will have discussion rooms devoted to debate issues related to disruptive technologies. This will be setting up what would be a meeting place for entrepreneurs, students, academics and social leaders sponsored by this cryptocurrency; that would promote its use in all aspects of local and national development.
result.description:
My Name is Wilmer Canelon (@wilmer.ac @cocmunvzla @smartcahslara), I am an economics student and passionate about blockchain technolology. For about 3 years i have been organizing mainly academic events, and since february 2018 i have held 5 conferences with an attendance over 370 people and an indirect interaction that exceeds approximately 2000 people. All this has been financed with contributions basically by local businesses. I see in SmarCash the potential to consolodare itself not only as a cryptocurrency, but as a tool for economic, social and cultural transformation in up coming years.

 

Therefore. i belive faithfully in the need to promote this product in the region, with the firm conviction that the event we are proposing will cause an initial impact, which will be the tip of the iceberg that contributes to the development of the Lara SmarCash's community.

From September 19 to 22, the city of Barquisimeto in Lara state of Venezuela will host the first SmartCash event in the region; where about 20 delegations from institutions of university education, representatives of the Industrial Chambers Federation and Commerce Chambers of Lara state, more than two dozen of social leaders of non-govermmental organizations and bussiness entrepreneurs from all over the country will meet; all in a space configurred especially as an encounter that projects innovation and breaks the traditional schemes of the different social. economic and political agents of the country. 

 

this 4-day event is divided as follows:

  • September 19th, 2018. Wednesday: Blockchain Congress "Disruptive Ideas". With an estimated participation of approximately 550 people. If will be held at the Juares Theater of Barquisimeto, which has a maximum capacity of 705 people. There will be 9 presentations on the following topics:
  1.      Emerging digital markets.
  2.      The blockchain revolution.
  3.      General aspects of criptocurrencies.
  4.      SmartCash, a financial instrument 
  5.      SmartCash and the new global governace. 
  6.      Innovation and entrepreneurship 
  7.      Disruptuve technology in international organizations. 
  8.      Socio-cultural and educational approach of fintech. 
  • September 20, 2018. Thursday: Debate Rooms for Students. Through 7 discussion rooms, about 200 young people of 20 educational institutions from differen parts of Venezuela will simulate the challenges and opportunities that technological innovations and SmartCash provide us in a globalized wordl, with the ultimate goal of visualize SmartCash as an effective, reliable and sustainable alternative in the different proposed contexts.
  • september 21, 2018. Friday: Entrepreneurship Fair and SmarCash Business Round.  With more than 25 StatUp, a dozed of Non-Govemmental Organizations, and the two maon Commerce and Industry Chambers Federations of the region, all of them will be able to experience the SmartCash benefits while exposing their inicitiatives, gnerating a feedback that will nourish the business exchanges in a win-win relationship.
  • September 22, 2018. Saturday: SmartCash Interactive Public Policies Forum. for the closing of the event a forum will be held in order to provide general feedback on everything contributed during the previous days. In addition, through a strong activity in social networks, particiapnts will be able to interact on their experiences, and special guests in a round panel will talk about the use of SmatCash and blockchain technology within public policies. 
  • Beyond September, 2018: to ensure that the investment made in SmarCash-COCMUN2018 has an impact greater than the net days of duration of the event, an budget is estimated for postproduction consisting of the edition of the audivisual material obtained from the event (photos, videos, spot, interviews, reports...) with high quality of general content that will be available for diffusion of the different smartcash communities in the world, and budget is estimated advertising for two weeks after the end of the event, in order to position the success of the same in different media 2.0 and achieve international trending topic.
